ccg-setinfo.name: Captain's Log
ccg-setinfo.game: Star Trek Collectible Card Game: Second Edition

card.name: A Pattern of Lies
card.text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless at least one of them is a different species than the others, all three ar stopped.

card.name: An Issue of Trust
card.text: Unless you have Honor or Treachery, all your personnel are stopped. If you have two or more personnel who have Honor or Treachery, randomly select all but one of those personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Armed Search Party
card.text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless they have Strength>17 or you have a non-Hand Weapon equipment, for each headquarters mission you command, randomly select one of those personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

card.name: Chameloid Chicanery
card.text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If your opponent has an Infiltrator at this mission, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

card.name: Compassionate Interference
card.text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal a Biology personnel from your hand or reveal a Geology personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

card.name: Contaminating a Culture
card.text: Randomly select a personnel to be killed. You may prevent this by placing once of your equipment cards present in its owner's discard pile.

card.name: Difficult Rescue
card.text: Unless you have Shields + remaining Range>the number of personnel attempting this mission, randomly select a personnel to be killed and all your other personnel are stopped.

card.name: Hull Breach
card.text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal an Astrometrics personnel from your hand or reveal a Navigation personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

card.name: Imagined Emergency
card.text: Unless you have Engineer, Exobiology, and Medical or Leadership, Security, and Strength>30, randomly select a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may move up to two dilemmas from beneath one of your missions to another of your non-headquarters missions.

card.name: Joint Operation Drills
card.text: Your opponent names a skill. For each headquarters mission you command, randomly select a person who has that skill to be stopped.

card.name: Last Gasp
card.text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped. Unless you reveal a Leadership personnel from your hand or reveal an Officer personnel from your hand, that personnel is killed instead.

card.name: Necessary Execution
card.text: Your opponent chooses a personnel to be killed. If you do not command a completed space mission, he or she chooses an additional personnel to be killed.

card.name: Nose to Nose
card.text: Randomly select two personnel. If they both have the same cost, they are both stopped.

card.name: Psionic Attack
card.text: Unless you have Medical and Science or 3 Security, randomly select a personnel to place on the bottom of his or her owner's deck. If that personnel has Anthropology, randomly select an additional personnel and place that personnel on the bottom of his or her owner's deck.

card.name: Sabotaged Reactor
card.text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Engineer, and Navigation or Leadership, Officer, and Cunning>28, all your personnel are stopped and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - This ship is Range -2.

card.name: Stand-Off
card.text: Unless you have Anthropology, Diplomacy, and Honor or Law, Security, and Strength>28, randomly select a Leadership personnel, place him or her in your opponent's brig, and all your other personnel are stopped.

card.name: Symbalene Blood Burn
card.text: Unless you have Biology, Exobiology, and Medical or Officer, Security, and Strength>28, randomly select four personnel to be stopped and place this dilemma on your ship at this mission. Damage - At the start of each turn, randomly select a personnel on this ship to be killed.

card.name: Temporal Conduit
card.text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and Leadership or Programming, Science, and Transporters, your opponent places this dilemma on one of your completed missions. At the end of each of your turns, your opponent may place a dilemma from beneath one of your other missions beneath this mission.

card.name: Thermokinetic Explosion
card.text: Unless you have Astrometrics, Navigation, and Cunning>30 or total ship's attributes>21, place this dilemma on your ship and all your personnel are stopped. Damage - At the start of each of your turns, choose an opponent. That opponent may download a Damage card and place it on this ship.

card.name: Under Pressure
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Unless you have Astrometrics, Engineer, and Navigation or Biology, Medical, and Science, randomly select a personnel to be killed. You may randomly select two personnel to be stopped to prevent this.

card.name: Federation Compression Rifle
card.text: Hand Weapon. While in combat, each of your {Voy} personnel present is Strength +1. While facing a dilemma at a {DQ} mission, each {Voy} Security personnel present is Strength +1.

card.name: Modified Tricorder
card.text: When your personnel present are facing a dilemma at a {DQ} mission, you may discard a card from hand to make each {Voy} Biology and each {Voy} Science personnel present attributes +1 until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: A Sight for Sore Eyes
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {sf} personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, score 5 points. At the end of each of your turns, if you have at least 5 points, lose 5 points.

card.name: Confessions of a Captan
card.text: Plays in your core. While your {fed}{Voy} Leadership personnel is attempting a mission, you may destroy this event to make him or her gain a skill from a {fed}{Voy} personnel present until the end of this turn.

card.name: Dark Pursuit
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. When the player on your right's personnel begin a mission attempt, you may draw one extra dilemma for each Pursuit card you command.

card.name: Destiny Reset
card.text: Temporal. Plays in your core. When you have drawn dilemmas, you may destroy this event and remove those dilemmas from the game to search your dilemma pile for up to two dilemmas whose total cost does not exceed the number of dilemmas you removed. Place those dilemmas on your dilemma stack in any order. Then shuffle your dilemma pile.

card.name: Finding Our Way
card.text: To play this event, you must not command a headquarters mission. Plays on your Caretaker's Array. Cards an opponent owns cannot prevent or destroy this event. When a card instructs you to place a personnel on your headquarters mission, that personnel may be placed aboard your {Voy} ship instead. Order - Discard a card from hand to download a {Voy} ship.

card.name: Make a Run for It
card.text: Pursuit. Plays in your core. If your opponent moves from a mission where you have a ship that has its Commander aboard, place this event on that ship. When your opponent's personnel attempt this mission, you may draw an extra dilemma and spend one extra on dilemmas.

card.name: Making It Work
card.text: Replicate- Discard a card from hand. To play this event, you must command three {Voy} personnel. Remove a damage card from your ship. Destroy this event.

card.name: New Discovery
card.text: Pursuit. Plays in your core. When your ship moves from a mission where an opponent has a ship, you may examine the top two dilemmas of that opponent's dilemma pile and replace them in any order.

card.name: Parallel Course
card.text: Pursuit. Plays in your core. When your opponent moves from a mission where you have a staffed ship, you may take a dilemma from beneath that mission and return it to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Political Putsch
card.text: To play this event, you must command two Treachery {baj} personnel. Plays in your core. When you play this event, remove all events in each player's discard pile from the game. When an event is played, prevent that event and remove it from the game unless that event's owner has an event in his or her discard pile.

card.name: Rule of Acquisition #16
card.text: Rule. To play this event, you must command three {fer} personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may destroy this event to spend an additional counter this turn for each card on this event. Order - Stop your {fer} personnel to place a card from hand on this event.

card.name: Starting Over
card.text: Count the number of cards in your hand and discard your hand to draw an equal number of cards. Then, if you command a Borg personnel, draw two additional cards. Destroy this event.

card.name: The Dominion Will Prevail
card.text: Maneuver. Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin an engagement involving your {dom} Officer personnel. If you win, the opponent on your left places the top two dilemmas of his or her dilemma pile beneath one of your non-headquarters missions.

card.name: The Long Journey Home
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {Voy} personnel. Plays on your Caretaker's Array. When you command four completed {DQ} space missions and have 100 or more points, you win the game.

card.name: The Spirit of Kahless
card.text: Assault. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat involving your {kli} Honor personnel. If you win, the opponent on your left places the top two dilemmas of his or her dilemma pile beneath one of your non-headquarters missions.

card.name: A Long Road
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command a Navigation personnel. Order - Discard a card from hand to take up to two Pursuit cards from your discard pile into hand.

card.name: And Raise You
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {Voy} personnel. When your personnel begin a mission attempt, make an opponent reveal the top three cards of his or her dilemma pile. Then replace those dilemmas in the same order. You may then make that opponent shuffle his or her dilemma pile.

card.name: Fajo's Menagerie
card.text: Order - Download an equipment card, then draw a card for each non-Hand Weapon equipment you command.

card.name: Preventative Ritual
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {rom} personnel. Order - Reveal the top four cards of an opponent's deck and place one of those cards on the bottom of that deck. Replace the remaining cards in any order on top of that deck.

card.name: Surprise Snag
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must discard the top three cards of your deck. When you are about to draw dilemmas, draw one extra dilemma and spend one extra in total cost on dilemmas.

card.name: Sweet Nothings
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {fer} personnel. Order - Choose an opponent to reveal his or her hand. You may draw a card for each interrupt revealed.

card.name: Targeting the Nacelles
card.text: Pursuit. When your opponent's ship is about to move from a mission where you have a staffed ship that has its Commander aboard, you may discard an event from hand to make that opponent's ship Range -3 until the end of the turn.

card.name: Warp Speed Transfer
card.text: Pursuit. While your personnel aboard a ship are facing a dilemma, move your staffed ship to that mission from a different mission and place one of your personnel aboard that ship abour the ship attempting the mission. That personnel joins the mission attempt.

card.name: Caretaker's Array
card.text: Biology, Diplomacy, Science, and Integrity>22 At the start of each of your turns, you may discard a card from hand to download Finding Our Way. When a card instructs you to place a ship at your headquarters mission, that ship may be placed at this mission instead.

card.name: Collect Omicron Particles
card.text: Astrometrics, Engineer, Leadership, Navigation, and Cunning>36 Nebula. When a ship is about to move between another {DQ} mission and this mission, subtract 1 from the Range required.

card.name: Explore Micro-Wormhole
card.text: Astrometrics, Officer, Transporters, and Cunning>32 When you complete this mission, you may place any number of personnel on your ship here on your ship at an {AQ} mission.

card.name: Investigate Alleged Murder
card.text: Diplomacy, Law, Officer, and Integrity>27 You may attempt and complete this mission using your {na} personnel with these requirements: Anthropology, Security, Transporters, and Strength>28.

card.name: Investigate Unknown Element
card.text: Anthropology, Leadership, Officer, and Integrity>27 or Exobiology, Geology, Science, and Cunning>30

card.name: Observe Kazon Ritual
card.text: Anthropology, Honor, Officer, Transporters and Integrity>31 or Astrometrics, Navigation, Security, Treachery, and Strength>34

card.name: Obtain Advanced Technology
card.text: Anthropology, Diplomacy, Honor, and Integrity>29 or Security, Transporters, Treachery, and Cunning>30

card.name: Basso Tromac (Smug Subordinate)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Law {SD}Treachery While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may remove a card in your discard pile from the game to add its cost to this personnel's attributes until the end of the mission attempt. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Kira Nerys (Blockade Commander)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer Commander: Kitara. While this personnel is aboard your Kitara, that ship is attributes +2.

card.name: Zayra (Bigoted Witness)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Archaeology {SD}Physics {SD}Transporters {SD}Treachery While this personnel is present with your non-{baj} personnel, he cannot use his skills.

card.name: Fifth (Neonatal Drone)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Medical {SD}Security Drone. Order - Stop this personnel to take a non-dilemma card you own from on top of your event into hand.

card.name: Second (Neonatal Drone)
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Programming {SD}Science Drone. When your unique Borg present is about to be stopped, you may discard a random card from hand and stop this personnel to prevent that.

card.name: Macet (Skeptical Commander)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery Commander: Trager. Gul. While this personnel is aboard your Trager and this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may meet Diplomacy and Honor requirements of that dilemma using Treachery instead.

card.name: Umat'Adan (Eager Fifth)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Biology {SD}Navigation {SD}Science Alpha. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, return your non-Alpha Jem'Hadar present to its owner's hand to make this personnel attributes +2 until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Andreas Colter
card.text: {SD}Officer {SD}Programming {SD}Security While this personnel is facing a dilemma, each of your Security personnel present is Strength +1.

card.name: B'Elanna Torres (Straightforward Engineer)
card.text: {SD}2 Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}Treachery Order - If this personnel is aboard your ship, discard a card from hand to remove a Damage card from that ship. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Baxter (Wandering Security Officer)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Geology {SD}Security When this personnel is placed in his owner's discard pile from play, you may take an event from your discard pile into your hand.

card.name: Bennet
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Geology {SD}Science {SD}Security When you play this personnel, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card from hand.

card.name: Cavit (Apprehensive First Officer)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Security While this personnel is attempting a {DQ} mission, you may make him attributes +3 until the end of the turn. If you do this and fail this mission attempt, kill this personnel. Otherwise he is stopped. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Chakotay (Bridge Between Two Crews)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Security When your {fed} personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may destroy an event in your core to prevent that.

card.name: Harry Kim (Eager to Please)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Biology {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}Transporters While this personnel is facing a dilemma at a {DQ} mission, each of your Programming personnel present is attributes +1.

card.name: Jadzia Dax (Defiant Captain)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Officer {SD}Physics {SD}Science {SD}Transporters Commander: U.S.S. Defiant. Host. While this personnel is aboard your U.S.S. Defiant, she loses {Stf} and gains {Cmd} and Leadership.

card.name: Joe Carey (Next In Line)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery While this personnel is attempting a mission, if there are three or less dilemmas beneath that mission, he is attributes +1.

card.name: Kathryn Janeway (Clever Captain)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}2 Leadership {SD}Science

card.name: Kathryn Janeway (Forceful Captain)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Science Commander: U.S.S. Voyager. While this personnel is facing a dilemma at a {DQ} mission, she is attributes +4.

card.name: Kenneth Dalby (Insubordinate Crewman)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming {SD}Security {SD}Treachery At the start of each of your turns, you may examine the top card of an opponent's deck. You may choose to place that card on the bottom of its owner's deck.

card.name: Kosinski (Arrogant Engineer)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Navigation {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}Transporters While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he is Cunning -2 and loses Astrometrics and Navigation.

card.name: Larson (Security Team Member)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Geology {SD}Physics {SD}Science {SD}Security {SD}Transporters When your {Voy} personnel present is stopped, stop this personnel.

card.name: Lyndsay Ballard (Back From the Dead)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Honor {SD}Navigation {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Science While this personnel is facing the last dilemma on your opponent's dilemma stack, you may kill her to make each {Voy} personnel present attributes +1 until the end of this turn.

card.name: Matthew Dougherty (Misguided Admiral)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery Admiral. Order - Destroy your staffed {E} ship or your staffed {TNG} ship to make all your personnel attributes +3 until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Marie Kaplan (Observant Officer)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Medical {SD}Science {SD}Transporters While this personnel is at a {DQ} mission, she gains Biology and Medical.

card.name: Marquay
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}Security {SD}Transporters {SD}Treachery While this personnel is attempting a mission, if there are three or more dilemmas overcome beneath that mission, he gains Security and Treachery.

card.name: Rachel Garrett (Displaced Captain)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer {SD}Transporters Commander: U.S.S. Enterprise-C. When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, randomly return one of your personnel present to his or her owner's hand.

card.name: Samantha Wildman (First Mother on Voyager)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Science When you play this personnel, you may return a non-dilemma card on your Decay event to its owner's hand.

card.name: Seska (Cardassian Agent)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Intelligence {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}2 Treachery Infiltrator. When this personnel uses a skill, your {fed} Leadership personnel and your {fed} Officer personnel are attributes -1 until the end of the turn.

card.name: Seven of Nine (Reclaimed Drone)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}Physics {SD}Programming

card.name: Stadi (Focused)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Geology {SD}2 Navigation {SD}Telepathy {SD}Transporters When you play this personnel, you may make your {Voy} ship Range +2 until the end of the turn.

card.name: The Doctor (Emergency Medical Hologram)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Medical {SD}Science When your {Voy} personnel present is about to be killed by a dilemma that costs 3 or more, you may discard two cards from hand to stop that personnel instead.

card.name: Tom Paris (Best Pilot You Could Have)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Medical {SD}2 Navigation While this personne is aboard a {Voy} ship, that ship is Range +2.

card.name: Tuvok (Chief of Security)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Security While this personnel is facing a dilemma that requires Officer or Security at a {DQ} mission, he is attributes +2 and gains Security.

card.name: Quark (Little Green Man)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Anthropology {SD}Physics Commander: Quark's Treasure. While this personnel is present with a {Pa} personnel, he is attributes +1 and gains Acquisition, Diplomacy, and Treachery.

card.name: Rata (Profiteer)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery When you play this personnel, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an event, you may draw two cards.

card.name: Tog (Lecherous DaiMon)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Officer {SD}Security {SD}Transporters Commander: Krayton. While you have four or more cards beneath your Ferenginar, this personnel is attributes +1 and gains Treachery.

card.name: Jadzia Dax (The Second Heart)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Honor {SD}Physics {SD}Science Host. Order - Stop your Honor Klingon present and destroy an event in your core to take an event from your discard pile into hand.

card.name: K'Temoc (Long Slumbering Commander)
card.text: {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery Commander: I.K.S. T'Ong. When this personnel is involved in combat and you command more Assault events than each opponent, you may kill this personnel to unstop each of your Klingon personnel present at the end of that combat.

card.name: Worf (The Strongest Heart)
card.text: {SD}2 Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Security When your Host or Honor Klingon present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Grebnedlog (Pakled Captain)
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer Commander: Mondor. While present with a non-{na} personnel, this personnel loses Honor and gains Transporters and Treachery.

card.name: Kes (Curious Ocampa)
card.text: {SD}2 Biology {SD}Geology {SD}Medical {SD}Science {SD}Telepathy While you command a completed planet mission, place this personnel in her owner's discard pile.

card.name: Lal (Beloved)
card.text: {SD}Programming While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may reveal three Androids from hand to make her attributes +4 and gain any two skills until the end of the turn. If you do this, she is killed at the end of this turn. You may only do this once each turn.

card.name: Martia (Duplicitous Chameloid)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Science {SD}Treachery Shape-shifter. Order - This personnel gains one skill and one keyword from one of your personnel present. She keeps that skill and keyword until this order is executed again.

card.name: Neelix (Morale Officer)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}Navigation Commander: Baxial. While facing a dilemma at a {DQ} mission, this personnel gains Acquisition and Honor.

card.name: Shran (Reluctant Diplomat)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery Commander: Kumari. When one of your non-Andorian personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop this personnel to prevent that.

card.name: Tam Elbrun (Prodigal Telepath)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Telepathy At the start of each of your turns, you may reveal a random card from an opponent's hand for each completed mission you command. Choose one of those cards to be placed on the bottom of that opponent's deck.

card.name: Thon
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Navigation {SD}Programming Order - If you do not command a completed space mission, discard a random card from your hand to place this ship this personnel is aboard at your incomplete space mission. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Vosk (Temporal Fanatic)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}2 Treachery For each Temporal event in your core, this personnel is attributes +1 (limit +4). When you do not command a Temporal event, place this personnel in his owner's discard pile.

card.name: D'Tan (Curious Youth)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Archaeology {SD}Geology {SD}Honor {SD}Science Dissident. When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, choose an opponent to discard the top card of his or her deck.

card.name: The Viceroy (Advisor to the Praetor)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Medical {SD}Telepathy {SD}Treachery When an opponent plays an event, you may discard a card from hand to download an event.

card.name: Charles Tucker III (Chief Engineer)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}Transporters While this personnel is facing a dilemma and the first mission you completed this game was a space mission, you may stop this personnel to replace all levels of any one skill in that dilemma's requirements with 2 Engineer. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Erika Hernandez (Comparable Captain)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Security Commander: Columbia. While this personnel is aboard your Columbia, that ship is attributes +2.

card.name: Daniel Leonard (Cautious Admiral)
card.text: {SD}Leadership {SD}2 Navigation {SD}Officer Admiral. When you play this personnel, you may download a {sf} ship.

card.name: Trager (Patrol Ship)
card.text: When this ship is about to move from an opponent's mission, subtract 2 from the Range required.

card.name: Cochrane (Voyager Shuttle)
card.text: While you do not command a headquarters mission, you may play this ship at Caretaker's Array or at the same mission as your U.S.S. Voyager. While you command six or more personnel aboard this ship, it is Range -2. This ship is attributes +1 for each Navigation personnel aboard.

card.name: Drake (Voyager Shuttle)
card.text: While you do not command a headquarters mission, you may play this ship at Caretaker's Array or at the same mission as your U.S.S. Voyager. While you command six or more personnel aboard this ship, it is Range -2. While you command a Temporal event in your core, this ship is Range +3.

card.name: U.S.S. Defiant (Patrolling Warship)
card.text: Cloaking Device. When an opponent's ship moves to this mission, if this ship's Commander is aboard it, that opponent's ship is stopped.

card.name: U.S.S. Enterprise-C (Yesterday's Enterprise)
card.text: When you complete a {kli} mission, if this ship is at that mission, score 5 points.

card.name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E (Flagship of the Federation)
card.text: When you play this ship, for each {TNG} Leadership personnel at this mission, this ship is cost -1. Order - Stop your {fed} Diplomacy personnel aboard this ship and return your event with no cards on it to its owner's hand to have each opponent return one of his or her events with no cards on it to its owner's hand.

card.name: U.S.S. Voyager (Home Away From Home)
card.text: While you do not command a headquarters mission, you may play this ship at Caretaker's Array. While this ship is at a {DQ} mission, you may play {Voy} personnel, {na} personnel, and equipment aboard this ship. When you play this ship, you may place up to two {Voy} personnel from your hand aboard this ship.

card.name: U.S.S. Yangtzee Kiang (Modified Transport)
card.text: While you command eight or more personnel aboard this ship, it is Range -3. When this ship is about to move between your headquarters mission and a non-headquarters mission, subtract 1 from the Range required. Order - Discard two events from hand to make this ship Range +2 until the end of this turn.

card.name: Krayton (Trade Envoy)
card.text: Order - If this ship has its Commander aboard it, discard a Rule card from your hand to add the discarded card's cost to the Range of this ship. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Quark's Treasure (Sabotaged Shuttle)
card.text: Order - If this ship has its Commander aboard it, lose 5 points to take an additional turn after this one. At the end of that turn, you lose the game.

card.name: I.K.S. T'Ong (Sleeper Ship)
card.text: Cloaking Device. When you win an engagement with this ship and its Commander is aboard it, you may place a {kli} personnel from hand aboard this ship.

card.name: Baxial (Salvage Ship)
card.text: While you do not command a headquarters mission, you may play this ship at Caretaker's Array or at the same mission as your U.S.S. Voyager. While you have six or more events in your discard pile, this ship is attributes +3.

card.name: Jovis (Museum)
card.text: While you have more Artifacts in your core than any opponent, each Treachery personnel aboard this ship is attributes +1.

card.name: Mondor (Far From Home)
card.text: While you have its Commander aboard it, this ship is attributes +1 for each non-{na} personnel aboard. (limit +4)

card.name: Columbia (The Second Warp Five Ship)
card.text: While the first mission you completed this game was a space mission, this ship is attributes +1. While a personnel aboard this ship is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to have that personnel gain Astrometrics or Science until the end of the mission attempt.
